website_summaries.verdict: If you seek a cold-brew gadget that's reasonably priced, fits in the fridge and decants strong java concentrate directly into glasses, you can't go wrong with the Bialetti Cold Brew Coffee Maker.
pros: The Bialetti Cold Brew is compact enough to fit easily into the refrigerator for storage
It conveniently pours coffee from its glass pitcher for simple service
Its filter basket has a wide mouth to receive grounds and create less mess
Makes large batches of strong coffee concentrate
cons: It's more expensive than basic cold-brew coffee pitchers.You need to drain its filter basket by hand

customer_reviews.title: Cracked again
customer_reviews.text: Edit. I bought this from Kroger and it started leaking one day. I found the bottom of the glass Randomly cracked so the coffee would leak. So I bought another one off of Amazon and last night while I was making cold brew it leaked and I found the bottom of the glass cracked again. Keep in mind this is room temperature and I do not put it in the dishwasher or anything so I’m not sure what is going on. Must be a defect, stay away and get a toddy
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Addicting Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This brewer is very easy to use, clean and makes the most amazing iced coffee I've ever tasted! Don't worry about the minimal amount of "silt" that gets through the basket, it will stay at the bottom unless you decide to pour it all into your cup because you don't want to waste a drop! Love the fact that the glass decanter is protected from accidental bumps against sharp objects so it lasts a while. I trusted the brand from a prior purchase of an espresso pot and Bialetti is always a quality crafted product. Thank you for the divine coffee experience!
customer_reviews.author: Lori M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cold Brew Pitcher!
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described and arrived when expected. Nice cold brew pitcher which works better than a French press style cold brew pitcher. Coffee grounds are all in filter container, no coffee press that need to be meticulously cleaned after every use. Just dump the coffee into the trash and rinse the filter container. Also, the rubbery holder over the container does well in not letting coffee grounds seep(?) in-between the holder and clear container like most other cold brew pitchers. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Santiago A.

customer_reviews.title: I love my cold brew in the morning
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as promised. I love my cold brew in the morning. Just make sure your coffee grounds are not ground too fine, or they will go through the steep.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It’s makes a strong batch compared to other cold brew coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: As CNET review it does make a strong batch of cold brew coffee. They used a ppm device but the proof is in the pudding and you can taste it instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Tora-Tora-Tora

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this....if you loved iced coffee it's a definite must buy. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Battersby

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Dropped mine broke it so buying a second one Only thing is the coffee grounds have to be coarse or they soak through the net inside and get in the coffee but other than that it's great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love my cold brew set up -- if you are looking for a simple brew system, with convenient pot, this is for you
customer_reviews.author: K.G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Cold Brew
customer_reviews.text: It makes good cold brew coffee. The one thing that would really help is to have measurement markings for the water quantity on the outside of the glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Style N. Craft Leathers, Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to make and clean
customer_reviews.text: The best choice for someone who don’t like how other classic cold brewers make the coffee. It’s simple and easy to clean. The price is very cheap compare to Toddy or Oxo
customer_reviews.author: Satrio Wahyudi

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product
customer_reviews.text: Product came completely damaged and unusable, the glass was broken on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: larixa calleja

customer_reviews.title: Base of Glass Carafe Breaks Very Easily
customer_reviews.text: When this product first arrived, I noticed that the glass in the base of the carafe was very cracked and would not hold liquid without leaking. I returned the product and ordered it again, thinking it may have been a shipping issue. However, upon first use of new carafe, the base cracked again. I would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: Best Cold Brew Maker!!
customer_reviews.text: Eat cold brew maker on the market hands down. I have used so many of these over the years and this is always the one I come back too. It is my second as my first broke due to my own fault washing it.
customer_reviews.author: hart3856

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job for what it is
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job for what it is, but I do find that the last couple glasses have some sediment in them. Overall though I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wreck It...

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye bitter coffee
customer_reviews.text: This really does make very smooth brew....no more bitter coffee
customer_reviews.author: Oldshovel

customer_reviews.title: Quality problems
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a small crack at the vessels rim. Returned and ordered replacement. That one had an identical crack. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Coffee too strong if you follow directions
customer_reviews.text: When I followed the instructions, it was way too strong and used too much coffee. When I used less coffee, it was more palatable. I noted that other reviews mention the same issue and have their own suggestions on how they used less. Also, no matter how coarse the grind, I still had specks of coffee, so the mesh isn't really small enough to filter out all. To get all of it out, I would have to filter with a traditional paper filter prior to using. The quality of the pot though is nice otherwise and it is dishwasher safe which is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: GAMS Mommy

customer_reviews.title: This produces good, though not (yet) great cold brew.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good cold brew maker. If I had never used the tall, slender cold brew maker from Japan that I bought early in the summer--which is, simply, the best cold-brew-producing device that I have ever used--I would probably have liked this better. But the Japanese cold brew carafe produces excellent cold coffee reliably, while it takes a bit of modifying and fiddling to get the proportions right on the Bialetti. The Bialetti IS a good cold brew maker, and it is quite a bit less expensive than the Japanese carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Worddancer Redux

customer_reviews.title: Cold brew made easy
customer_reviews.text: The Bialetti Cold Brew Maker does a fantastic job of cold brewing coffee with ease. You must use COARSE ground coffee or you will have grinds all through your brew. I had to do the conversions from metric to figure out how much ground bean/ water to use which was a little annoying but tolerable. The design of the pot is nice. The vessel is glass and mesh filter is metal. All of the black parts are plastic. It is dishwasher safe and is designed to be able to fit on most refrigerator doors.
customer_reviews.author: Mom22boys

customer_reviews.title: Glass is thin and cracks at bottom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product twice from kroger's fred meyer stores and it cracked both times after about 1 month, I loved the coffee it's made but glasss is too thin the bottom has cracked in both purchase, I think just from setting it on the counter or maybe from washing it in warm water.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Cold brew is smooth
customer_reviews.text: Cold-brewing is a great way to make coffee - there's a lot less acid making the brew not bitter. This carafe is a convenient way to brew. Your best bet is to use coarse ground coffee. The directions require a LOT of coffee - 25 scoops. It makes a small amount of concentrated coffee. You can mix this 1 part coffee to 3 parts water. I like hot water. It does taste really good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use
customer_reviews.text: It's even simpler than the instructions tell you. I use ordinary coffee ground for my Mr. Coffee maker (specifically Folgers). I don't remove the filter basket it at all. Just leave it there and the brew will slowly diffuse out of it, increasing the yield. The brew get stronger with time so use less. Remove the grounds when the brew is all gone. Simple.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bourque

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. It gets heavy use in my house and ...
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. It gets heavy use in my house and still keeps ticking.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Cold Brew Is Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get in on the cold brew coffee craze, but it just wasn't for me. The process is easy to follow with one exception - finding the right amount of coffee to use. It made decent coffee, but I wound up zapping it in the microwave in the end. It was too much effort for mediocre results. I say pass.
customer_reviews.author: Philip R. Heath

customer_reviews.title: USES A LOT OF COFFEE GROUNDS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just couldn't use as much grounds as they tell you to, I'm just not rich enough to use most of a bag of coffee all at once. So, I messed around and made a smaller batch. Large grind works best for the least amount of coffee grounds in your coffee and I really like the taste. they have the taste down, it's just that I can't use that much coffee beans all at once. If you don't mind spending that much money on coffee grounds, then this really is a good coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Great Ice Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great for making ice coffee easily. Put your coffee in the center container, put it in the brew maker, add water, then let it steep for at least 12 hours. The coffee is nice and smooth. This is much easier (and less bitter tasting) than what we were doing before, which was manually straining out the coffee grinds with a fine strainer. It's also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: A Gamer at Heart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cold-coffee brewing
customer_reviews.text: It's obvious from the other reviews that many other people have enjoyed this cold-brew Bialetti coffee maker. This is the first time we've had one and I have to agree that from my husband's perspective, who is the one who drinks coffee in our home, it's great. Glad to have it. We'll learn more about the finer ins and outs as time goes on. He's enjoying it quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Todd

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Make Excellent Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy cold brew because it has less bitterness and acid than other coffee methods. This brewer makes it comfortable and clean. I've used a Toddy and French press before and this Bialetti is much better. With either of those methods, grounds slip through. This brewer keeps all the grounds in a mesh chamber in the middle. That also means more grounds get extracted. Although there are exact measurements, I tend just to wing it. Fill the main chamber with grounds and the rest with water. This method, unlike pour-overs, is very forgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Greenbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great Homemade Cold Brewed coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've just discovered Cold Brew recently. This makes it easy to make. Tip for richer coffee: let it brew 36 hours instead of 24.
customer_reviews.author: Ike Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nice brewer, but instructions make too strong of a concentrate
customer_reviews.text: I've made cold brew coffee for over a decade, and after I graduated from Toddy pots to French presses everyone I convinced to do cold press has started to migrate to more effective (and simpler) brewers. Thus I was eager to try this. It's not exactly a French press but more akin to that than my Toddy pot. I prefer my giant Bodum to this, but 8 have no reservations recommending this. Just use your own guidance on mix of course ground beans to water. The included instructions are way too strong!
customer_reviews.author: Shane O. Laake
